function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Large amount of data collected from sensors can lead to privacy and security risks if not handled properly.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Overreliance on iot technology may lead to a lack of human judgment and intervention in critical healthcare decisions.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of covid-19 through person-to-person contact","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of control over the environment and workplace conditions","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited awareness and compliance with safety guidelines","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Varying success rates of policies based on location, density, and cultural practices.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of research on pandemic governance.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"People not following covid-19 protocols such as maintaining six feet distance and other health protocols","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of adoption of pandemic-resistant urban design recommendations","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Failure of measures due to lack of consideration for cultural beliefs and practices","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Evolution of crisis leading to uncertain conclusions","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Congregations in public spaces increase the risk of virus transmission due to close contact and crowded environments.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on physical presence for the functioning of public spaces creates a challenge in controlling virus transmission.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Economic impact of a complete lockdown creates pressure to design and build resilient public spaces to withstand future pandemics.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inclusive urban planning and management of multi-functional public spaces over preventive design strategies","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduction in public transportation usage leading to increased use of private vehicles","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in online shopping leading to reduced physical footfall in retail spaces","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of physical distancing in public spaces","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate monitoring of public spaces","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate adaptation of urban design to promote physical distancing","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased reliance on online shopping as a result of in-person shopping limitations","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Link between average income, age group, and virus transmission","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Challenges of stay-at-home orders in neighborhoods without public or private open spaces","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Zone-based lockdown for covid-19 suppression","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for pandemic consequences in architectural and urban design education","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Shift in social behavior and neighborhood dynamics due to covid-19","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Horizontal expansion and decentralization can lead to increased transmission of contagious diseases due to greater connectivity between different areas.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High-density districts and crowded urban areas can lead to higher morbidity rates of covid-19 and increased vulnerability among older people and men.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decreased immunity due to physical inactivity and social distancing measures","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact on socio-economic composition of cities","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High density urban areas facilitating easier transmission of communicable diseases due to increased social contact","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Questioning the effectiveness of 6 feet physical distancing in urban spaces","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Vulnerability of architectural practices in accommodating pandemic procedures","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High concentration of covid-19 cases in a major wholesale market.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure of alternative options to mitigate the transmission of the virus.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for post-pandemic behaviors in public spaces.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Economic impact of shutting down public spaces in densely populated areas","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased transmissibility of sars-cov-2 variants","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Psychological aversion to big crowds and necessary changes in public spaces","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate air circulation and natural light may lead to high humidity, increasing the risk of viruses sticking and spreading easily.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of greenery near living and working areas may impact mental well-being and stress levels of occupants.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited access to green spaces in living areas","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation and fresh air supply in unit apartments","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Congestion of activities in the house due to lockdown regulations may lead to a reduction in privacy for family members, impacting mental health and well-being.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of separate sanitation facilities and buffer spaces may increase the risk of virus spread within the household.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate access to nature may impact the mental and physical health of occupants, especially during prolonged lockdown periods.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on natural ventilation may lead to inadequate air exchange, allowing viruses and particles to accumulate indoors.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High humidity levels in rooms may promote the growth of mold and mildew, leading to respiratory health issues.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of proper ventilation and airflow in apartment units","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate access to daylight and natural light","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"}]}
